awd_titl_txt: CAREER: Obfuscation from a Complexity Theoretic Perspective
awd_abstract_narration:
Obfuscation schemes are highly desirable tools for transforming programs into unintelligible ones while preserving functionality. However, so far, there lack obfuscation schemes with well-founded security guarantees. The main objective of this project is addressing this gap, by developing new approaches for designing obfuscation schemes based on standard, well-studied, assumptions.  Another objective is using obfuscation as a versatile tool to enable a wide range of cryptographic and security applications. This research will advance the state of design and application of obfuscation schemes, and more generally cryptographic feasibility, which contribute to building a more secure and private cyberspace. 

The research focuses on a form of obfuscation, called Indistinguishability Obfuscation (IO). Specific research problems include finding simpler cryptographic objects, algebraic structures, generalization of standard objects, and assumptions that imply IO. The project also investigates what can be built from standard assumptions, and develops new techniques that overcome existing technical barriers in applying IO, as well as general techniques for removing the use of IO to obtain simpler and more efficient solutions for specific applications. This project actively engages in disseminating knowledge of obfuscation, teaching cryptography to undergraduate and graduate students, and supporting women in STEM. These activities will contribute to building a skilled and diverse workforce and enriching the scientific community.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
Computer programs may contain sensitive information and proprietary knowledge. The goal of program obfuscation is transforming computer programs into obfuscated forms, which provide the same functionality as the original programs but become hard to decipher its inner workings. In cryptography, a mathematical formulation of program obfuscation is called indistinguishability obfuscation. It has been shown to be a powerful concept that can be used to realize a wide range of cryptographic goals. This project develops the first indistinguishability obfuscation scheme, based on three well-studied assumptions, namely, the Decision Linear assumption over pairing groups, the hardness of Learning Parity with Noises problem over large fields, and the existence of constant-local Pseudorandom Generators. The new construction establishes the feasibility of cryptographic obfuscation on solid grounds.    

This project also investigates the feasibility of program obfuscation with even stronger security guarantees, known as Virtual Black-Box obfuscation, and presents a construction of virtual black-box obfuscation scheme using a variant of the widely used Random Oracle heuristic, called Pseudo Random Oracle. Additionally, this project performs cryptanalysis on candidate indistinguishability obfuscation schemes based on integer lattices, invalidating several recently proposed schemes. New constructions of primitives related to indistinguishability obfuscation, including functional encryption and attribute based encryption schemes, have also been presented, with improved efficiency and functionalities.

 


Last Modified: 12/18/2023
Modified by: Huijia Lin
